trans-unit.source: Running the Chaos test.
trans-unit.target: Running the Chaos test.

trans-unit.source: This article talks about the pre-canned service fabric scenarios shipped by Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: This article talks about the pre-canned service fabric scenarios shipped by Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Large distributed systems like cloud infrastructures are inherently unreliable.
trans-unit.target: Large distributed systems like cloud infrastructures are inherently unreliable.

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric provides developers the ability to write services to run on top of unreliable infrastructures.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric provides developers the ability to write services to run on top of unreliable infrastructures.

trans-unit.source: In order to write high quality services, developers need to be able to induce such unreliable infrastructure to test the stability of their services.
trans-unit.target: In order to write high quality services, developers need to be able to induce such unreliable infrastructure to test the stability of their services.

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric gives developers the ability to induce fault actions to test services in presence of failures.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric gives developers the ability to induce fault actions to test services in presence of failures.

trans-unit.source: However, targeted simulated faults will only get you so far.
trans-unit.target: However, targeted simulated faults will only get you so far.

trans-unit.source: To take the testing further Service Fabric ships pre-canned test scenarios.
trans-unit.target: To take the testing further Service Fabric ships pre-canned test scenarios.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios simulate continuous interleaved faults, both graceful and ungraceful, throughout the cluster over extended periods of time.
trans-unit.target: The scenarios simulate continuous interleaved faults, both graceful and ungraceful, throughout the cluster over extended periods of time.

trans-unit.source: Once configured with the rate and kind of faults, it runs as a client side tool, through either C# APIs or PowerShell to generate faults in the cluster and your service.
trans-unit.target: Once configured with the rate and kind of faults, it runs as a client side tool, through either C# APIs or PowerShell to generate faults in the cluster and your service.

trans-unit.source: As part of the testability feature we ship the following scenarios.
trans-unit.target: As part of the testability feature we ship the following scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Chaos Test
trans-unit.target: Chaos Test

trans-unit.source: Failover Test
trans-unit.target: Failover Test

trans-unit.source: The chaos scenario generates faults across the entire service fabric cluster.
trans-unit.target: The chaos scenario generates faults across the entire service fabric cluster.

trans-unit.source: The scenario compresses faults generally seen in months or years to a few hours.
trans-unit.target: The scenario compresses faults generally seen in months or years to a few hours.

trans-unit.source: The combination of interleaved faults with the high fault rate finds corner cases which are otherwise missed.
trans-unit.target: The combination of interleaved faults with the high fault rate finds corner cases which are otherwise missed.

trans-unit.source: This leads to a significant improvement in the code quality of the service.
trans-unit.target: This leads to a significant improvement in the code quality of the service.

trans-unit.source: Restart of a Node
trans-unit.target: Restart of a Node

trans-unit.source: Restart of a Deployed Code Package
trans-unit.target: Restart of a Deployed Code Package

trans-unit.source: Remove of a Replicas
trans-unit.target: Remove of a Replicas

trans-unit.source: Restart of a Replica
trans-unit.target: Restart of a Replica

trans-unit.source: Move of a Primary Replica (optional)
trans-unit.target: Move of a Primary Replica (optional)

trans-unit.source: Move of a secondary Replica (optional)
trans-unit.target: Move of a secondary Replica (optional)

trans-unit.source: Chaos test runs multiple iterations of faults and cluster validations for the specified period of time.
trans-unit.target: Chaos test runs multiple iterations of faults and cluster validations for the specified period of time.

trans-unit.source: The time spent for the cluster to stabilize and validation to succeed is also configurable.
trans-unit.target: The time spent for the cluster to stabilize and validation to succeed is also configurable.

trans-unit.source: The scenario fails when we hit a single failure in cluster validation.
trans-unit.target: The scenario fails when we hit a single failure in cluster validation.

trans-unit.source: For example, consider a test set to run for 1 hour and with maximum 3 concurrent faults.
trans-unit.target: For example, consider a test set to run for 1 hour and with maximum 3 concurrent faults.

trans-unit.source: The test will induce 3 faults, then validate the cluster health.
trans-unit.target: The test will induce 3 faults, then validate the cluster health.

trans-unit.source: The test will iterate through the previous step till cluster becomes unhealthy or 1 hour passes.
trans-unit.target: The test will iterate through the previous step till cluster becomes unhealthy or 1 hour passes.

trans-unit.source: If in any iteration the cluster becomes unhealthy, i.e. not stabilize within a configured time, the test will fail with an exception.
trans-unit.target: If in any iteration the cluster becomes unhealthy, i.e. not stabilize within a configured time, the test will fail with an exception.

trans-unit.source: This exception indicates something has gone wrong and needs further investigation.
trans-unit.target: This exception indicates something has gone wrong and needs further investigation.

trans-unit.source: In its current form the test Chaos test fault generation engine induces only safe faults.
trans-unit.target: In its current form the test Chaos test fault generation engine induces only safe faults.

trans-unit.source: This means that in absence of external faults a quorum or data loss will never occur.
trans-unit.target: This means that in absence of external faults a quorum or data loss will never occur.

trans-unit.source: TimeToRun: Total time that the test will run before completing with success.
trans-unit.target: TimeToRun: Total time that the test will run before completing with success.

trans-unit.source: The test can complete earlier in lieu of a validation failure.
trans-unit.target: The test can complete earlier in lieu of a validation failure.

trans-unit.source: MaxClusterStabilizationTimeout: Max amount of time to wait for the cluster to become healthy before failing the test.
trans-unit.target: MaxClusterStabilizationTimeout: Max amount of time to wait for the cluster to become healthy before failing the test.

trans-unit.source: The checks performed are whether Cluster Health is OK, whether Service Health is OK, Target replica set size achieved for service partition and no InBuild replicas.
trans-unit.target: The checks performed are whether Cluster Health is OK, whether Service Health is OK, Target replica set size achieved for service partition and no InBuild replicas.

trans-unit.source: MaxConcurrentFaults: Maximum number of concurrent faults induced in each iteration.
trans-unit.target: MaxConcurrentFaults: Maximum number of concurrent faults induced in each iteration.

trans-unit.source: The higher the number the more aggressive the test hence resulting in more complex failovers and transition combinations.
trans-unit.target: The higher the number the more aggressive the test hence resulting in more complex failovers and transition combinations.

trans-unit.source: The test guarantees that in absence of external faults there will not be a quorum or data loss, irrespective of how high this configuration is.
trans-unit.target: The test guarantees that in absence of external faults there will not be a quorum or data loss, irrespective of how high this configuration is.

trans-unit.source: EnableMoveReplicaFaults: Enables or disables the faults causing the move of the primary or secondary replicas.
trans-unit.target: EnableMoveReplicaFaults: Enables or disables the faults causing the move of the primary or secondary replicas.

trans-unit.source: These faults are disabled by default.
trans-unit.target: These faults are disabled by default.

trans-unit.source: WaitTimeBetweenIterations: Amount of time to wait between iterations i.e. after a round of Faults and corresponding validation.
trans-unit.target: WaitTimeBetweenIterations: Amount of time to wait between iterations i.e. after a round of Faults and corresponding validation.

trans-unit.source: C# Sample
trans-unit.target: C# Sample

trans-unit.source: Powershell
trans-unit.target: Powershell

trans-unit.source: The Failover test scenario is a version of the Chaos test scenario targeting a specific service partition.
trans-unit.target: The Failover test scenario is a version of the Chaos test scenario targeting a specific service partition.

trans-unit.source: It tests the effect of failover on a specific service partition while leaving the other services unaffected.
trans-unit.target: It tests the effect of failover on a specific service partition while leaving the other services unaffected.

trans-unit.source: Once configured with the target partition information and other parameters it runs as a client side tool either using C# APIs or Powershell to generate faults for a service partition.
trans-unit.target: Once configured with the target partition information and other parameters it runs as a client side tool either using C# APIs or Powershell to generate faults for a service partition.

trans-unit.source: The scenario iterates through a sequence of simulated faults and service validation while your business logic run on the side to provide a workload.
trans-unit.target: The scenario iterates through a sequence of simulated faults and service validation while your business logic run on the side to provide a workload.

trans-unit.source: A failure in service validation indicates an issue that needs further investigation.
trans-unit.target: A failure in service validation indicates an issue that needs further investigation.

trans-unit.source: Restart a Deployed Code Package where partition is hosted
trans-unit.target: Restart a Deployed Code Package where partition is hosted

trans-unit.source: Remove a Primary/Secondary replica or Stateless instance
trans-unit.target: Remove a Primary/Secondary replica or Stateless instance

trans-unit.source: Restart a Primary Secondary Replica (If persisted service)
trans-unit.target: Restart a Primary Secondary Replica (If persisted service)

trans-unit.source: Move a Primary Replica
trans-unit.target: Move a Primary Replica

trans-unit.source: Move a secondary Replica
trans-unit.target: Move a secondary Replica

trans-unit.source: Restart the partition.
trans-unit.target: Restart the partition.

trans-unit.source: Failover test works induces a chosen fault and then runs validation on the service to ensure its stability.
trans-unit.target: Failover test works induces a chosen fault and then runs validation on the service to ensure its stability.

trans-unit.source: The Failover test only induces one fault at a time as opposed to possible multiple faults in Chaos test.
trans-unit.target: The Failover test only induces one fault at a time as opposed to possible multiple faults in Chaos test.

trans-unit.source: If after each fault the service partition does not stabilize within the configured timeout the test fails The test induces only safe faults.
trans-unit.target: If after each fault the service partition does not stabilize within the configured timeout the test fails The test induces only safe faults.

trans-unit.source: This means that in absence of external failures a quorum or data loss will not occur.
trans-unit.target: This means that in absence of external failures a quorum or data loss will not occur.

trans-unit.source: PartitionSelector: Selector object specifying the partition that needs to be targeted.
trans-unit.target: PartitionSelector: Selector object specifying the partition that needs to be targeted.

trans-unit.source: TimeToRun: Total time that the test will run before completing
trans-unit.target: TimeToRun: Total time that the test will run before completing

trans-unit.source: MaxServiceStabilizationTimeout: Max amount of time to wait for the cluster to become healthy before failing the test.
trans-unit.target: MaxServiceStabilizationTimeout: Max amount of time to wait for the cluster to become healthy before failing the test.

trans-unit.source: The checks performed are whether Service Health is OK, Target replica set size achieved for all partitions and no InBuild replicas.
trans-unit.target: The checks performed are whether Service Health is OK, Target replica set size achieved for all partitions and no InBuild replicas.

trans-unit.source: WaitTimeBetweenFaults: Amount of time to wait between every fault and validation cycle
trans-unit.target: WaitTimeBetweenFaults: Amount of time to wait between every fault and validation cycle

trans-unit.target: C# Sample
